page.title: 04FARMING IN KEMPSTON
page.content: The farms are in the area of{clay and {loam soil.Mainly arable,}all farms grow wheat and barley, but in addition {livestock}is kept, so silage and hay are also produced. Machinery is used extensively. Mr Barbour has farmed {Vicarage Farm}for twenty six years. There is a herd of thirty Hereford and Friesian cross{beef cattle,}and six sheep.{Tythe Farm,}farmed by Mr Owen for seventeen years was once owned by the church and still pays a contribution towards maintaining All Saints Church chancel roof. Rape is an additional crop and six dairy heifers are kept for breeding and sale. Each year at{Top Farm}Mr Lacey rears and fattens for sale sixty thousand chicks and two hundred pigs. Mr Frossel has farmed{Wood End Farm}for thirty nine years and keeps a herd of forty three Friesian and Limousin beef cattle.
